intro: Desmochaeta sordida, commonly known as the sordid desmochaeta, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. Its small, five-petaled flowers are usually pale pink to white, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Desmochaeta sordida is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a common weed in certain regions.
